title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 §§ 1100-9.1 - Final determination on applications
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 §§ 1100-9.1 - Final determination on applications

State Regulations
(a) The Office shall mail to the applicant
and its representative, if applicable, a determination in the form of: a
permit, including all applicable uniform standards and conditions and any
site-specific conditions, or a statement that the permit applied for has been
denied, with an explanation for the denial, as follows: (1)

Within six (6) months of the Office
deeming the application complete for major renewable energy facilities in which
the proposed site is a repurposed site as defined by this Part; or
(2)

Within one (1) year of the Office deeming
the application complete for all other major renewable energy
facilities. (b) Upon
mutual consent of the applicant and the Office, the time periods set forth in
subdivision (a) of this section may be extended up to an additional thirty (30)
days. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16
§§
1100-9.1

Transferred from 900-9.1

New

York State Register July 17, 2024/Volume XLVI, Issue 29, eff. 6/26/2024

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
